do you have anything on the separate HDD? If not reload Ubuntu on it. You could also put gparted on a flash drive reformation the HDD that wont boot.

you can run your live cd and install gparted from add/remove. Keep in mind that any added apps you run in your live cd will be thrown into ram. Once you have gparted installed, you can reformat the HDD in question.
Do I have to reformat the entire disk? I've got a bunch of stuff I don't want to lose, and no external drives
you can copy your files over using the Live Cd. You will need to try to mount your HDD in question while in the live cd session.
can you even access recovery console (hitting ESC) key during grub boot?
I'll reboot and try.
copy your files over in the live session and reload Ubuntu. May save you time.
if you can reach recovery console w the ESC key, drop to root shell with networking and run apt-get update.

if you have a separate HDD (such as a 3rd one) you may want to consider installing Ubuntu on it, so you can back up your HDDs accordingly then format away and do another install on the drive of choice.
